title: Konstas' MCG debut confirmed, Head faces a fitness test - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Konstas to Make MCG Test Debut as Head Faces Fitness Test

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Sam Konstas will debut for Australia on Boxing Day, becoming the fourth-youngest Test debutant. Meanwhile, coach Andrew McDonald expresses confidence in Travis Head's fitness after a minor injury.

  • Sam Konstas will make his Test debut against India at 19 years and 85 days old.
  • Coach Andrew McDonald confirms Konstas was notified of his selection.
  • Travis Head is undergoing a fitness test after suffering a minor quad strain.
  • Australia will make at least two changes, with Konstas and Scott Boland replacing Nathan McSweeney and Josh Hazlewood, respectively.
“We said from the get go, when leading into the summer, that we wouldn't shy away, and age was no barrier,” said McDonald.

The announcement of the final team lineup is expected on Christmas Day.

Ben Stokes Ruled Out of Cricket for Three Months Due to Injury

Date: Tue, Dec 24, 2024 Source: Cricbuzz

Ben Stokes has been ruled out of all cricket for at least three months with a torn left hamstring, sustained during the third Test against New Zealand, which England won.

  • Stokes missed the England squad for the Champions Trophy due to his injury.
  • He had previous injury issues, including knee surgery in October 2023.
  • In August, he suffered a similar hamstring injury that limited his playing time.
  • Stokes had been managing his workload and opted out of IPL 2024.
  • He expressed confidence in his physical fitness before the injury occurred.
  • He will also miss next year's Hundred competition starting on January 9.
“I have to work so much harder on the physical side of the job to allow me to go out and do my job...” - Ben Stokes

This latest injury adds to Stokes' challenges on the field, potentially impacting England's future performance.

title: "I Deserve It. Let India Decide...": What Manu Bhaker Told Father On Khel Ratna Snub - NDTV Sports
summary:
Some Orders Being Followed: Manu Bhaker's Father Hints At Khel Ratna Snub 'Conspiracy'

Publication Date: July 29, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Manu Bhaker, despite her remarkable achievements including two bronze medals at the Paris Olympic Games, has been snubbed for the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award by the Sports Ministry. Her father, Ram Kishan, implies a questionable decision-making process within the committee, voicing their belief that she is deserving of the award and criticizing the lack of respect for Olympic medalists.

  • Manu Bhaker won two bronze medals at the Paris Olympics, making history for female shooters in India.
  • Her father claims there may be a conspiracy behind the lack of recommendation for the prestigious Khel Ratna award.
  • There is a contrast between the Sports Ministry's claim that Manu did not apply for the award and her father's assertions of multiple applications.
  • Her absence from the nominees list has disappointed many supporters, further fueled by previous controversies surrounding her social media posts.
"Despite such a fantastic performance if Manu is not recommended for Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna, then I am forced to believe that all is not well in the committee, or some orders were being followed." - Ram Kishan

This controversy raises questions about the integrity of the awards process and highlights the challenges faced by athletes in India. Manu Bhaker's story reminds us of the need for recognition and support for those who achieve excellence in sports.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker's Father Accuses Sports Ministry of Conspiracy Over Khel Ratna Snub

title: How Australian cricketers Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Travis Head and others described BCCI and ICC: Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Australian Cricketers Comment on ICC and BCCI Ahead of Test Match

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Amid rising tensions between India and Australia, Australian cricketers, including Pat Cummins and Travis Head, made their comments on the ICC and BCCI during a game organized by ABC Sport.

  • Pat Cummins described ICC, BCCI, and Indian cricket as 'Big'.
  • Travis Head referred to the BCCI as 'rulers' and the ICC as 'second'.
  • Glenn Maxwell, Alex Carey, and Steve Smith called the BCCI 'powerful' while describing the ICC as 'boss' and 'not as powerful'.
  • Steve Smith later backtracked on his remark, claiming it was a joke and restated the ICC as 'leaders'.
  • Usman Khawaja chose to 'pass' on describing the ICC, referencing past controversies with the organization.
“No, no I can't say that. It was a joke.” - Steve Smith

The light-hearted game shed light on the players' perceptions of cricket's governing bodies as they prepare for the crucial Border-Gavaskar Trophy match.

title: 'I am alive because…': Vinod Kambli clutches doctor's hand, gives first statement from hospital bed - Hindustan Times
summary:
Vinod Kambli's Emotional Hospital Statement: Grateful to Doctors

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli, recovering from clots in his brain, expressed profound gratitude to his doctors for saving his life during an emotional hospital statement while receiving treatment in Thane.

  • Kambli was hospitalized due to clots in his brain, reportedly in critical condition.
  • He recounted a touching moment of holding his doctor’s hand and thanked them for their care.
  • His condition deteriorated recently after suffering from a urinary infection.
  • Despite past financial struggles, Kambli expressed commitment to rehabilitation if offered help by the cricket community.
  • Acknowledged support from fans and the medical team during his recovery.
"I am alive because of the doctors here. All I would say is that I will do whatever sir (referring to the doctor) asks me to. People will see the inspiration that I'll give them," said Kambli.

Kambli's ongoing recovery brings hope, as he remains grateful for the support from both healthcare professionals and fans, highlighting a poignant chapter in his life.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli's Emotional Hospital Statement: Grateful to Doctors

India has announced the inclusion of 26-year-old Tanush Kotian for the final two Tests in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, replacing Ravichandran Ashwin, who has retired from international cricket.

  • Kotian made his first-class debut at age 20 and has since claimed 101 first-class wickets and scored 1525 runs.
  • He played a pivotal role in Mumbai's Ranji Trophy victory, finishing as Player of the Tournament.
  • Digging deep into his early career, Kotian was part of India's Under-19 team in 2017 but missed out on the World Cup.

title: Jio and Star to operate as unified entity from India-England series - Cricbuzz
summary:
Jio and Star to Operate as Unified Entity from India-England Series

Published on: Mon, Dec 23, 2024, 05:16 PM | Source: Cricbuzz

With the completion of the mega-merger between Jio and Star, the two sports broadcasting giants will start operating as a unified entity during the England tour of India.

  • The merger allows for cross-promotion of properties across platforms.
  • The England series will be broadcast live on Star Sports and Disney+ Hotstar, along with original platforms like JioCinema.
  • The transaction of the joint venture was worth INR 70.352 crore (USD 8.5 billion).
  • Reliance Industries invested Rs 11,500 crore (1.4 billion) into the venture.
  • Star Sports remains a leading sports channel in India but has faced competition from rivals like Sports18 and JioCinema.
“The merger of the media and JioCinema businesses of Viacom18 into Star India Private Limited (SIPL) has become effective.” - Reliance Industries Limited

This integration marks a new era in sports broadcasting in India, potentially reshaping how cricket and other sports are presented to the audience.
newTitle: Jio and Star to Operate as Unified Entity from India-England Series

title: Mumbai experiment with Suryakumar Yadav, Shreyas Iyer and Shivam Dube at Nos 8, 9 and 10 in scramble chase - The Indian Express
summary:
Mumbai's Bold Batting Experiment in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Indian Express

In a surprising turn of events during the Vijay Hazare Trophy, Mumbai’s traditional batting order was flipped on its head in a chase against Hyderabad. Despite the unconventional strategy, Mumbai managed to secure a victory.

  • Mumbai chased down a target of 170 runs with a score of 175/7 in 25.1 overs.
  • Key players Suryakumar Yadav, Shreyas Iyer, and Shivam Dube were placed at No 8, 9, and 10 in the batting order.
  • Shreyas Iyer scored a quick 44 runs off 20 balls, helping secure the win after Mumbai was precariously at 67/6.
  • Atharva Ankolekar was the standout bowler for Mumbai, taking 4 wickets for 55 runs.
  • Maharashtra also shined in the tournament with Ruturaj Gaikwad scoring 148 not out, significantly contributing to their chase against Services.
  • Baroda achieved a mammoth total of 403 runs, defeating Kerala, while Delhi overcame Madhya Pradesh with a notable performance from Navdeep Saini.
"It was a bold move from Mumbai as their top-7 featured established names. Skipper Shreyas took it upon himself to lead the comeback."

The innovative batting strategy of Mumbai sparked discussions among cricket fans, revealing both risks and rewards in match strategy.
newTitle: Mumbai's Bold Batting Experiment in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Tanush Kotian to Join India's Test Squad as Ashwin's Replacement

Tanush Kotian, a talented offspin-bowling allrounder from Mumbai, has been chosen to replace R Ashwin in India's Test squad for the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests.

  • Kotian will fly to Melbourne following Ashwin's retirement after the third Test.
  • He is in Ahmedabad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy as part of the Mumbai squad.
  • The fourth Test starts on Thursday, with the series being tied 1-1.
  • Kotian has a first-class record of 101 wickets and 1525 runs in 33 matches.
  • He was instrumental in Mumbai's Ranji Trophy success, earning the Player-of-the-Tournament award.
  • Kotian is alongside Manav Suthar in being viewed as a future prospect for the India Test setup.
“Kotian was the only player to complete the season double of 500 runs and 25 wickets.”

This inclusion highlights Kotian's rising profile and adds depth to India's spinning options as they navigate the crucial Test matches ahead.
newTitle: Tanush Kotian to Join India's Test Squad as Ashwin's Replacement

title: Melbourne Pitch To Help Jasprit Bumrah And Co. In Boxing Day Test vs Australia? Curator Says: "As Mu.. - NDTV Sports
Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia - The Times of India
summary:
Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Times of India

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has announced the addition of all-rounder Tanush Kotian to the Indian cricket squad for the fourth and fifth Tests of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Kotian, an off-spinner from Mumbai, has been rewarded for his impressive performances in domestic cricket.
  • He has taken 101 wickets in 33 first-class matches at an average of 25.70, including three five-wicket hauls.
  • Kotian has scored two centuries and 13 half-centuries.
  • The 24-year-old's standout performances in the 2023-24 Ranji Trophy season helped Mumbai achieve victory.
  • He was named Player of the Tournament, scoring 502 runs at an average of 41.83 and taking 29 wickets at an average of 16.96.
  • Kotian replaces R Ashwin, who announced his retirement after the third Test.
Kotian's addition provides the Indian team with an additional spin-bowling option and batting depth as they aim to clinch the series against the formidable Australian side.

The series is currently tied at 1-1 after three Tests, making these upcoming matches crucial for both teams.
newTitle: Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia
